.  Culross is a charming village some 10 miles west of
, in Fife.  It has a palace, abbey and many fine and restored buildings from the 16th and 17th century.
It is easily reached from Edinburgh and Glasgow, and is well worth a one day trip.
Buses run every hour or so from
. Stagecoach 78 takes about half an hour from Dunfermline
. There are connections at Dunfermline from
The Palace, Study and Town House are in the care of the National Trust for Scotland
. These are open afternoons only between Mid-March and the end of October. The restored town is a rare example of a 17th-century burgh.

value: Listen to music at the Culross Festival in early August
